contextId.information: Remembrance represents praise. AT: "For when people die, they no longer praise you" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]] and [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_abstractnouns]])
contextId.quote: For in death there is no remembrance of you

contextId.information: The noun "desires" can be expressed with the verb "want. "AT: "the things that he wants very much to do" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_abstractnouns]])

In speaking of Yahweh's "covenant faithfulness," David is trusting that Yahweh will always love him. AT: "I trust that you will faithfully love me" (UDB) (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_abstractnouns]])
contextId.quote: I have trusted in your covenant faithfulness

contextId.information: The word "distress" describes the condition of one who has many troubles.  AT: "Strong enemies attacked me on a day when I had many troubles, but Yahweh protected me" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_abstractnouns]])
contextId.quote: They came against me on the day of my distress but Yahweh was my support

contextId.information: This means that it is God who has rescued him. AT: "the God who rescued me" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_abstractnouns]])
To "execute vengeance" means to punish people for their evil actions. AT: "the God who punishes people for the evil things they have done to me" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_abstractnouns]])
contextId.quote: the God who executes vengeance for me

contextId.information: The abstract noun "blessings" can be stated as a verb. AT: "you bless him greatly" or "you give him many good things" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_abstractnouns]])
The abstract noun "life" can be stated as a verb. AT: "He asked that you cause him to live for a long time; you caused it to happen" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_abstractnouns]])
contextId.quote: He asked you for life; you gave it to him

contextId.information: The abstract noun "fullness" can be stated with the verb "fills." AT: "and everything that fills it" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_abstractnouns]])
The abstract noun "rebelliousness" can be stated as "rebelled." AT: or about how I have rebelled against you" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_abstractnouns]])
The abstract noun "affliction" can be stated as a verb. AT: "the things that afflict me" or "how afflicted I am" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_abstractnouns]])
The abstract noun "salvation" can be stated as "saves." AT: God who saves me" or because you are the God who saves me" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_abstractnouns]])
The abstract noun "desires" can be stated as a verb. AT: "Do not let my enemies do to me what they desire" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_abstractnouns]])
contextId.quote: Do not give me up to the desires of my enemies

contextId.information: The abstract noun "strength" can be stated as "strong." AT: "Yahweh makes his people strong" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_abstractnouns]])
contextId.quote: Yahweh is the strength of his people

contextId.information: The abstract noun "holiness" can be stated as "holy." AT: "Remember that God is holy and thank him" or "Remember what God has done because he is holy and thank him" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_abstractnouns]])
contextId.quote: Give thanks when you remember his holiness

contextId.information: The abstract noun "favor" can be stated as the adjective "good." AT: "but he is good to us all of our lives" (UDB) (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_abstractnouns]])
contextId.quote: but his favor is for a lifetime

contextId.information: The word "confidence" is an abstract noun. The writer recalls a time when he was prospering and felt confident and safe. AT: "When I was confident" or "When I felt safe" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_abstractnouns]])
The abstract noun "favor" can be stated as the verb "favored" or the adjective "kind." AT: "when you favored me" or "when you were kind to me" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_abstractnouns]])

It was customary for the Jews to dance when they were very happy. The abstract nouns "mourning" and "dancing" can be stated as verbs. AT: "You have caused me to stop mourning and to dance with joy instead" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_abstractnouns]])
contextId.quote: You have turned my mourning into dancing

contextId.information: This can be expressed with a verb. AT: "are the good things you do"  (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_abstractnouns]])
Here "plea" can be expressed with a verb. AT: "you heard me plead for help" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_abstractnouns]])
contextId.quote: you heard my plea for help

contextId.information: The abstract noun "destruction" can be stated in other forms. AT: "so that they will be destroyed" or "that is how you should destroy them" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_abstractnouns]])
The abstract noun "peace" can be stated in other forms. AT: "they do not speak peacefully to people" (UDB) (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_abstractnouns]])
The abstract noun "justice" can be stated with a verb. AT: "proclaim that you act in the right way" (UDB) (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_abstractnouns]])
The abstract noun "wisdom" can be stated as an action. AT: "gives wise advice to others" (UDB) (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_abstractnouns]])
The abstract noun "Salvation" can be expressed as an action. AT: "Yahweh rescues the righteous people" (UDB) (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_abstractnouns]])
contextId.quote: Salvation of the righteous comes from Yahweh

contextId.information: The word "boast" can be translated with a verb. AT: "we have boasted" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_abstractnouns]])
The word "rebuke" can be translated as a verb. AT: "You make us something that our neighbors rebuke" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_abstractnouns]])
contextId.quote: You make us a rebuke to our neighbors

contextId.information: Here God speaks of saving a person as if it were causing a person to see his salvation. He refers himself in the third person. AT: "I will save him" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_metaphor]] and [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_abstractnouns]] and [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_123person]])
The abstract noun "foolishness" can be stated as an action. AT: "the foolish things that I have done" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_abstractnouns]])
The abstract term "covenant faithfulness" can be stated as an action. AT: "you are good and love me faithfully" (UDB) (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_abstractnouns]])
These abstract nouns can be stated as actions. AT: "how people have rebuked me, shamed me, and dishonored me" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_abstractnouns]])
contextId.quote: my rebuke, my shame, and my dishonor

contextId.information: An "abundance" is when there is much of something. "much grain" or "plenty of grain" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_abstractnouns]])
The abstract noun "rebuke" refers to saying something in an angry or critical way. AT: "When you rebuked them" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_abstractnouns]])

In speaking of Yahweh's "covenant faithfulness" David is trusting that Yahweh will always love him. See how you translated this in [[:en:bible:notes:psa:013:005|13:5]]. AT: "faithful love" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_abstractnouns]])
"enabled your people to defeat their enemies" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_abstractnouns]])
"me as I teach you" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_abstractnouns]])
The word "salvation" can be translated with the verb "save": "God who saves us." (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_abstractnouns]])
The abstract noun "strength" can be stated as "strong." AT: "God who causes us to be strong" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_abstractnouns]])
The abstract noun "salvation" can be stated as a verb. AT: "God who saves us" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_abstractnouns]])
The abstract noun "faithfulness" can be stated as an adjective. AT: "For you are faithful to me because of your covenant" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_abstractnouns]])
contextId.quote: For great is your covenant faithfulness toward me

contextId.information: The abstract noun "strength" can be stated as an adjective. AT: "You make them wonderfully strong" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_abstractnouns]])
The abstract noun "faithfulness" can be translated with the adjective "faithful." AT: "tell people that you are faithful to keep your covenant"  (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_abstractnouns]])
The abstract noun phrase "your deeds" can be translated with the relative clause "what you have done." AT: "by what you have done"  (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_abstractnouns]])

The psalmist speaks of care as if he could count separate cares. The abstract noun "consolations" can be translated with the verb "console" or "comfort." AT: "When I have been worried about many things, you have comforted me and made me happy" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_abstractnouns]])
contextId.quote: When cares within me are many, your consolations make me happy

contextId.information: The abstract noun "salvation" can be translated using the verb "save." AT: "showed people that he saves his people" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_abstractnouns]])
The abstract noun "justice" can be translated using the phrase "what is just." AT: "he loves doing what is just" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_abstractnouns]])
"According to your steadfast love." The phrase "steadfast love" or "faithfulness" can be stated as an adverb. AT: "because you faithfully love me" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_abstractnouns]])

The abstract noun "faithfulness" can be stated as an adverb or adjective. AT: "that you faithfully love me" or "that you are faithful to me because of your covenant" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_abstractnouns]])
The abstract noun "understanding" can be stated as a verb. AT: "enable me to understand what you want me to know" (UDB) (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_abstractnouns]])
The word "oppression" can be translated as a verb. AT: "Save me from people who oppress others" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_abstractnouns]])
The abstract noun "persecutors" can be translated using the verb "persecute." AT: "Those who persecute me" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_abstractnouns]])
The abstract noun "rescue" can be stated as a verb. AT: "you to rescue me" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_abstractnouns]])
The abstract noun "mercy" can be stated as an action. AT: "act mercifully toward us" (UDB) (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_abstractnouns]])

The abstract noun "mercy" can be stated as an action. See how you translated a similar phrase in [[:en:bible:notes:psa:123:001|123:2]]. AT: "act mercifully toward us" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_abstractnouns]])

This is a request. The abstract noun "good" can be stated as an action. AT: "Yahweh, Please do good things" or "Yahweh, I beg you to do good things" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_abstractnouns]])

"Mercy" is not something that can physically be given to anyone. The author is asking for Yahweh to be merciful to him. AT: "to my pleas and be merciful to me" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_abstractnouns]])
Here "songs" represents acts of singing. AT: "our captors required us to sing" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_abstractnouns]])
contextId.quote: our captors required songs from us

contextId.information: The abstract noun "accomplishments" can be translated using the verb "accomplish." AT: "all that you have accomplished" or "all the great things you have done" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_abstractnouns]])

The writer speaks of Yahweh's command as if it were his messenger. The word "command" can be translated with a verb. AT: "He commands the ice to melt" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_metaphor]] and [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_abstractnouns]])
contextId.quote: He sends out his command and melts them

contextId.information: do what Yahweh had Moses write that people should do with those who are guilty (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_abstractnouns]])
contextId.quote: execute the judgment that is written
